translation: Leisurely at Home: 36th Edition

source_sentence: 宋孤山沙門　智圓　著
translation: Song Gushan śramaṇa Zhiyuan
to make a final homage, chanting, and dedication of merit

source_sentence: 某言循毗尼之雅誥遵調御之格言當炎風初入於樓臺咸稟護生之制及顥露方濡於草木同修自恣之儀況九旬淑慎以彌登三業策勤而靡曠莫不冰壺讓潔霜竹齊貞今則坐夏之限既圓遊方之心無阻於是集六和之眾先宣白二之言命五德之人次行對首之法殊無非相盡合真規有以見光釋子之行藏續佛法之壽命無涯景福謹進莊嚴恭願　今上皇帝化洽無為威加有截蠻貃咸修於職貢黔黎共樂於升平壟畝有秋陰陽不忒次願梵宇清肅緇侶安康經律論之三宗敷揚罔輟聞思修之慧行肆習克勤勝事繼興嘉名更盛然後增八部神靈之德執十方檀信之恩凡百有情皆登覺路。
translation: I say that following the elegant Letters of Vinaya and following the precepts of regulation, when the hot wind first entered the tower, everyone received the rules for protecting life, and when the dew first moistened the grass and trees, they all cultivated the ritual of self-restraint.
He then increased the eight divine offices, held to the benevolence of the Daṇḍalas in the ten directions, and returned to the path of awakening for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 某謹言洪儒之治國也置公候則畫野分邦俾同遵於制度我佛之出世也立寺宇則隨處結界令咸稟於律儀是以為邦國者制度不可亡為伽藍者律儀不可廢雖禪居律寺之別擁毳橫經之殊既同奉法王敢輒違戒範如當寺也瀕湖勝槩負郭幽居息心達本之人時時戾止放鶴[栽-木+土]蓮之客比比來儀既提領而得人則墜典而咸舉由是遠邀碩匠準彼律科結大戒以爰周令憲章而不墜而今而後誰云於地弱不勝自東自西皆知於正法久住所生福善謹進祝延　今上皇帝恭願天基永固寶歷長新秉鈞衡者則元愷術高治邦邑者則龔黃政美某等伏願禪枝長茂德岳彌高然後宰執靈祇法界含識同承妙祉咸造真源。
translation: I would like to say that when Hongru ruled a country, he set up a government, drew a boundary, and divided the country into states so that they would all follow the same rules. When the Buddha appeared in the world, he established temples, boundaries, and boundaries everywhere, so that they would all receive the precepts.
On the new year's day, he paid homage to the Buddha and returned to his ancestors.

source_sentence: 某言夏正啟運堯曆紀元當萬物以發生在羣方而布令青陽併集鴻福唯臻蓂階虔祝於帝圖月殿式延於叡化恭願　今上皇帝山呼獸舞皆康堯舜之期雲慶風祥盡屬禹湯之化次冀寺門清肅僧侶集和。
translation: I say that when all things come into being during the summer retreat, the Yao calendar year, when all things come into being in various directions and the Qing Yang merges with the collection of great merit, the only thing that reaches the peninsula is the consecration of the Di Tu Yue Hall, the style of the extension of the Ei Hwa temple, and the respectful vow that the emperor's mountain appeals and animal dances will be well received by the Yaosun emperor, that the clouds will be celebrated, that the breezes will be auspicious, and that the next wish is that the temple gates will be kept clear and the monks will gather in harmony.
During the winter retreat, we paid homage to the Buddha and returned to him.

source_sentence: 某言卿雲告瑞祕日初移群官列賀於明庭　聖主端居於右介在釋子之虔祝仗佛事之貽休　今上皇帝伏願處聖同堯承乾等漢四海之兵戈永息九陔之化道克施然後法輪不停慧光普照伽藍界內常布休祥。
translation: I say, "Your Excellency, you've announced that Ruiji's day has just begun, and the officials are lining up to congratulate him in the bright court. The noble lord is staying at his right side, where the Śākyamuni's pious invocation is supported by the Buddha's renunciant service. The emperor now vows that the noble ones, together with Yao and Chengqian, will permanently calm the armies and wars of the nine new worlds and make the Way known, and then the Dharma wheel will not stop and the light of wisdom will shine universally within the Kālāma realm and always spread rest and happiness.
On New Year's Day, he recites and dedicates his merits to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 上來念誦福善無疆　今上皇帝恭願帝基可久聖歷延長箕風畢雨以順時佛日慧燈而永耀然後宰執伽藍常施陰德。
translation: "After reciting the above recitation, his merits are boundless. Now, the emperor respectfully wishes that the emperor's foundation may be prolonged, that his noble history may be prolonged, that the winds may be blessed, that the rain may fall in obedience to the times, that the Buddha's sun and wisdom may shine forever, and that the Śākyamuni may always bestow the virtues of the aggregates.
Praying for rain and returning the blessings.

source_sentence: 茲日親迓朝蓋俯降蕭宮然百和之名香祝千輪之妙相俾願繇繇大野祈微布於陰雲蕩蕩極虗冀廣施於甘雨然後使民田普洽年糓有成寅仰梵儀不盡精欵其次功霑品物利潤含生等沐良緣齊登覺道。
translation: On this day, I greet the Chao Prabhū and bend down to the Xiao Palace, bestowing the fragrance of a hundred harmonies, blessed with the marvelous appearance of a thousand circles, and wishing that the great wilderness would be cared for, praying that the clouds would be spread thinly and the earth would be swept wide and that the sweet rain would be given, then the people's fields would be made generally prosperous, and the years would be fruitful.
I pray for a clear transfer of merit.

source_sentence: 伏以炎雲霮[雨/對]夏雨霶[雨/(湤-方)]既農務以有傷肆郡候而軫慮伏乞慈風遐扇驅屏翳以潛蹤慧雲下臨引曦和而爰駕俾三農而無忒冀百穀以有成某等不任歸依禱告之至。
translation: Fubu, because the hot clouds are dense [rain/oppositions] and the summer rains are [rain/(kaizen-fang)] both agricultural and seasonal, the county is in need of attention, and the request is for a compassionate breeze to fan out, expel the cataracts, and sneak up on the wisdom clouds to come down, guide the sun and drive, make the three farmers without fail, and hope for the success of the hundred grains, I beg you to take refuge in you and pray for you.
We would like to dedicate the summer retreat to you.

source_sentence: 伏以畏日當空薰風育物稟我佛護生之制是沙門禁足之初由是月殿閎開雲徒畢集玉偈高吟於梵韻差肩行右繞之儀金爐輕裹於香雲對首作安居之法自此九旬進道三業修真庶期鴻福以無涯用助丕圖而可久恭願　今上皇帝卜年卜世同覆載之長存乃聖乃神邁唐虞之至化知府運使諸廳朝貴共布袴襦之化即升台鼎之權次願寺宇昌隆僧徒輯穆迍憂不作檀施常臻土地真靈克施陰德。
translation: Since then, the moonlit palace has been open, the clouds have gathered, the disciples have gathered, the jade verse has been recited, the Sanskrit verse has been chanted, the shoulders have been made to walk around, the gold censer has been wrapped lightly in clouds of incense, and the head has been made to sit in the Dharma.
Commentary on the Evening Consultations

source_sentence: 右伏以罪福俱空照自心而可了生佛平等達本性以能通既理體以無差在助緣而豈礙於是歸依三寶敢虧精進之風懺悔十支庶復清淨之體洞義門而智慧開發入眾海而福德莊嚴盡此報齡同生淨剎轉化含識咸悟妙明然後恭願　聖曆等乎仙椿黎元躋乎壽域仰金輪而彌固期玉燭以長和某等不任拜首歸命殞越之至。
translation: Right, he submits that both sins and merits are empty, that he can understand the equality of birth and Buddha by illuminating his own mind, that he can penetrate the original nature without distinction, that the essence of principle is nondistinct, that there are no auxiliary conditions and that there are no obstructions, and that he therefore relies on the Three Treasures, dares to lack the wind of effort, repents of the ten limbs, and restores his pure body, penetrating the gate of meaning and developing wisdom, enters the ocean of merit and adorns the end of this age of retribution, is born together in the pure abode, transforms all beings and consciousnesses, and then realizes marvelous insight.
Buddha's intention for nirvāṇa

source_sentence: 右伏以法無去來道非生滅且聖凡而一致在高下以誰分既而迷此真常縈乎累縛故我佛大聖人垂妙應誘群機降生於微尼國中符瑞應於三界示滅於娑羅林內聲光駭於大千其種熟脫之緣過現未化蓋不可得而思議焉某幸賴宿因叨逢像法既偶還源之日是傾追遠之心由是率彼有緣營茲微供妙味雖非於香積至誠敢斆於純陀庶期上福君親下資動殖共食雪山之忍草咸明力士之額珠達自心源極佛境界某不任歸命殞越之至。
translation: Because the Dharma has no past and future, the path has no arising and ceasing, and because the noble and the unenlightened are the same in terms of who is superior and inferior, and because they are deluded about this true eternal lingering in a state of exhaustion, our Buddha, the great sage, gives birth to a multitude of opportunities, descends into a country of weak natures, produces portents that respond to the three realms, shows extinction in the Śālavana forest, and inspires a great chiliocosm that reaches a great chiliocosm with its various causes of liberation that are past present and unmanifested, it's impossible to fathom. I'm fortunate to have had the opportunity from long ago to meet the day when the Buddha's image returns to its origin.
Layman's Compilation No. 36
